title: A, P, R, X, S and Z are sitting in a row. S and Z are in the centre. A and P are at the ends. R is sitting to the left of A. Who is to the left of P? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since, S &Z are at the centres..therefore they will have equal no. of people towards their left & right. _ _ S Z _ _ A &P are at the extremes. So,the sequence becomes-: A _S Z _ P or P _ S Z _ A The next statement tells us, R is to the left of A, this implies A cannot be in the extreme left. So, the sequence comes out to be-: P X S Z R A It has been asked in the qn. abut the person sitting to the left of P. The sequence shows no one is present towards left of P.

We are told A and P are at the ends. This implies both of them can only have one neighbour - either to the left or to the right. We are also told that R is A’s left side neighbour. So A is at the right end of the row and P is to the left end of the row. Therefore, P can not have a left neighbour.
